elements.title: Clement Ligoure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Clement Ligoure (pictured) treated hundreds of blast victims at his home clinic following the Halifax Explosion in 1917?

elements.title: Barbizon Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York City's Barbizon Hotel hosted its first male guests on Valentine's Day in 1981 after operating as a women-only hotel for more than five decades?

elements.title: Yinka Ilori (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the artist and designer Yinka Ilori once made a collection of chairs that were inspired by a Nigerian parable about a giraffe?

elements.title: St Mary's Church, Mablethorpe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 14th-century St Mary's Church, Mablethorpe, in Lincolnshire, England, is constructed of material classified as random mixed rubble, red brick and slate?

elements.title: Bit House Saloon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bit House Saloon's menu featured Rocky Mountain oysters?

elements.title: William A. Brooks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after being a college football player, William A. Brooks became a prominent surgeon, and had several hospitals named after him?

elements.title: negotiated a truce to reduce homicides (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the government of El Salvador, the Catholic Church, and street gangs negotiated a truce to reduce homicides from 2012 to 2014?

elements.title: Edward Dando (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward Dando once ate 300 oysters with a loaf and a half of bread and butter in one sitting?
